questions.question: A bowler must bowl with a straight arm and cannot bend their elbow more than 15 degrees.
In Test cricket, there is no limit to the number of overs a bowler can bowl in succession.
A ball is called 'wide' if it passes outside the batsman's reach while they are in a normal stance.
A bowler can bowl consecutive overs from both ends of the pitch.
In ODI cricket, a bowler can bowl a maximum of 10 overs.
A bouncer is limited to 2 per over in international cricket.
The bowling crease is 8 feet 8 inches wide.
A no-ball is called if the bowler's front foot completely crosses the popping crease.
In T20 cricket, a bowler can bowl a maximum of 4 overs.
A bowler must inform the umpire if they intend to bowl around the wicket.
